name: Wong Kar-Wai's Hollywood fingerprints
description: Wong Kar-wai’s modern masterpiece In The Mood For Love is a rich, romantic melodrama that follows the entangled lives of two neighbours (Tony Leung and Maggie Cheung) who develop feelings for each other after learning their spouses are having an affair.

key_work.title: In the Mood for Love
key_work.creator_credit: Wong Kar-wai, William Chang, Block 2 Pictures, Jet Tone Production, Orly Films, Paradis Films and Universal Pictures
key_work.brief_description: In 1962 Hong Kong, Chow (Tony Leung) and Li-zhen (Maggie Cheung) are neighbours. Their respective spouses are having an affair and the two lonely souls find themselves increasingly attracted to each other, but resist repeating the betrayals of their partners.

end.title: Chungking express
end.creator_credit: Wong, Chan Yi-Kan and Jet Tone Production
end.brief_description: Director Wong Kar-Wai, working again with cinematographer Christopher Doyle brings together two loosely connected stories of unrequited love, drug smuggling, fast-food joints and melancholic cops. Revisiting his regular themes of chance vs fate and broken hearted loners, Wong Kar-Wai and Doyle (sharing his DOP duties with Lau Wai-Keung), again have created a heightened world of neon drenched cities and smokey bars, while the soundtrack repeats it’s ethereal refrain of the Mamas and the Papas California dreaming. The first story centers around the infamous Chungking mansions as a lovelorn cop, identified as No.223 (Takeshi Kaneshiro) yearns over a mysterious woman (Brigitte Lin) in dark sunglasses and a Marilyn Monroe style wig. Unbeknownst to the sombre detective, who has a peculiar nostalgic attachment to crushed canned pineapple, the woman is working on the other side of the law as a small time heroin smuggler. The second randomly linked story is set around the Midnight Express fast-food joint where cop No.663 (Tony Leung) spends most of his nights, recovering over a break up with an air hostess (Valerie Chow), unaware that the young woman who works behind the counter (Hong Kong rock star Faye Wong) is quietly infatuated with him. In Cantonese and Mandarin with English subtitles.

links.description: In The Mood For Love hinges on the vulnerable performances of its two leads, with star Tony Leung becoming the first Hong Kong actor to win Best Actor at Cannes. Leung also starred in Wong Kar-wai’s cult classic Chungking Express.

end.title: Infernal Affairs
end.creator_credit: Alan Mak, Andrew Lau, Media Asia Films and Felix Chong
end.brief_description: Chan Wing Yan, a young police officer, has been sent undercover as a mole in the local mafia. Lau Kin Ming, a young mafia member, infiltrates the police force. Years later, their older counterparts, Chen Wing Yan and Inspector Lau Kin Ming, respectively, race against time to expose the mole within their midst.

constellations_other.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_other.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

links.description: Considered one of the most important modern auteurs, Wong Kar-wai has had an enduring relationship with Leung who he has cast repeatedly in his films including Quentin Tarantino favourite Chungking Express. Leung was one of the co-leads in Infernal Affairs.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

links.description: Complex crime drama Infernal Affairs was a critical and commercial hit at the time of its release, so much so Martin Scorsese would later remake it with The Departed, which saw Leung’s role played by Leonardo DiCaprio.

start.title: The Rainmaker
start.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Aggie Guerard Rodgers, Fred Fuchs, Michael Douglas, Steven Reuther, Constellation Entertainment, Paramount Pictures, Howard Cummings and Michael Herr
start.brief_description: When Rudy Baylor, a young attorney with no clients, goes to work for a seedy ambulance chaser, he wants to help the parents of a terminally ill boy in their suit against an insurance company. But to take on corporate America, Rudy and a scrappy paralegal must open their own law firm.
